comments:
the environment in my pcs:
first I try on visual machine of redhat hat linux 9.0,with gtk2.0.
Following packages have been installed:
        epf-composer-1.0-M5-linux.zip ??unzip epf-composer-1.0-M5-linux.zip under the directory '/home/gj/epf-composer'
	j2sdk-1_4_2_12-linux-i586-rpm.bin??install in the directory '/usr/java',edit the /root/.bash_profile to set the 'JAVA_HOME','PATH','CLASSPATH' environment variables
	eclipse-SDK-3.2-linux-gtk.tar.gz??tar -zxvf eclipse-SDK-3.2-linux-gtk.tar.gz in the directory '/opt/eclipse'.eclipse can run successfully
	firefox-1.5.0.7.tar.gz??tar -zxvf firefox-1.5.0.7.tar.gz in the directory '/home/gj/firefox',edit the /root/.bash_profile to set  MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=home/gj/firefox
	cd /home/gj/epf-composer?? run epf using: ./epf??error occurs: 
'eclipase process framework composer cannot be started while another instance is running.Switch to the running instance or close it and restart the application again'.
run epf using './epf ?Cvm /usr/java/ j2sdk-1_4_2_12/bin/java',the error stills occurs.
so I try another linux version,redhat enterprise 4.0 gtk2.0.
the same error still exits.

I use command 'ps -A |grep eclipse' and 'ps -A |grep epf', it seems that there is no some relation process running.

I wonder to know how to solve this problems, and whether I have to install other software packages before using epf?

what's more,I have installed apache in my pcs ,but it is not running.

Could you please reply as soon as possible?

Thank you very much
Please outline the steps how to get EPF run on supported Linux systems: RHEL4U4, SUSI 9SP3 & 10.

cd /home/gj
tar -zxvf firefox-1.5.0.7.tar.gz
vim /root/.bash_profile
       ( MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/home/gi/firefox )
cd /home/gj/
unzip epf-composer-1.0-M5-linux.zip
cd epf-composer
chmod -R 777 epf-composer
     (because after I unzip the file ,I found the file named epf is not an executable file)
./epf

my linux system is :

cat /etc/rehdat-releas
Red Hat Enterprise Linux ES release 4 (Nahant Update 1)

Look forward your reponse as soon as possible
Thank you very much

Looks like there is a problem on initializing the workspace location for EPF. We are working on it and mean while you can use either of the following options to start EPF correctly.

Option 1) ./epf -nolock   ( or )  
Option 2) ./epf -data  <user-define-dir>/workspace 
(Ex: ./epf -data /home/gj/epf-composer/workspace )

Thanks

I have tried the two option 'nolock' and '-data',both of them can make the epf run.
Thank you very much.
But another problem occurs.
After select the library /home/gj/epf-composer/library, I can see the library and the configuration view. but when I tried to create a role,an error occurs:
IUPA0023E:Cannot open the editor associated with the selected Method element.
Reason:A system error has occured.the details shows like this:XPCom error 2147221164.
after clicked the ok tab of the error message, a new role node has already in the tree in the Library view, but when I double-click it,the same error occurs.

I also tried other actions such as create a displine,create a task and  so on. all of these actions lead to same error.

1. Define JAVA_HOME and add $JAVA_HOME/bin to your PATH
2. Your need to set the env var MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/usr/lib/firefox-1.0.7 (or whatever the correct path on your system)
3. Navigate to /usr/firefox-1.0.7/defaults/pref
4. Makethe firefox.js writable
5. Edit firefox.js and change the security preference for dom.disable_window_status_change preference to true. For example,
	pref("dom.disable_windows_status_change", false);
6. Save and exit

Please let us know it goes, and appreciate your use of EPF on Linux.

Thank you very much.
The epf in my Linux Enterprsie can run up now.  
I really appreciate your help.
Cannot reproduce this issue on RH9 and RHEL4U4, Fixed.

Thank you all for your help
best wishes
